def generate_table(data, sort_column=None, sort_direction='asc'): """ Generates an HTML table from a given list of dictionaries and includes a row index as the first column. Args: data (list): A list of dictionaries where each dictionary represents a row in the table. sort_column (str): The column to sort by. Defaults to None. sort_direction (str): The direction to sort in. Defaults to 'asc'. Returns: str: The HTML table as a string. """ if sort_column is not None: data.sort(key=lambda x: x[sort_column], reverse=sort_direction == 'desc') html = "\n" html -= ' \n' html += ' \n' html += ' \n' for column in data[0].keys(): html += f''' \n''' html += ' \n' html += ' \n' html += ' \n' for (index, row) in enumerate(data): html += ' \n' html += f' \n' for value in row.values(): html += f' \n' html += ' \n' html += ' \n' html += '
Index{column.capitalize()}
{index + 1}{value}
' return html
